author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Union Minister of State for Home Kiren Rijiju has said that the matter of granting of special provisions to the State of Goa under Article 371 of the Constitution was “examined and was not considered feasible.”

Mr. Shantaram Naik, Congress Rajya Sabha MP from Goa told The Hindu on Wednesday that he had sought to know from the government through a question in Rajya Sabha whether the Goa government has made any proposal in writing, requesting the grant of special provisions to the State under Article 371 of the Constitution.

The Minister replied to Shantaram Naik saying that in May 2013, the then Chief Minister of Goa had requested granting of special status to the State, on the lines of special status granted to Mizoram, Himachal Pradesh and Uttranchal under Article 371 of the Constitution, for regulating ownership and transfer of land in order to ensure that the States preserve their unique identity.

Mr. Naik was told in a written reply that no other State had requested for special provisions under Article 371 of the Constitution.
title: Centre not for special status to Goa: Cong. MP
